info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 25 at 1:00PM MST until September 25 at 3:30PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
FFWTWC
The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Cochise County in southeastern Arizona...
* Until 330 PM MST.
* At 100 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. Kartchner Caverns gauge recorded 1.06 inches in 30 minutes.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kartchner Caverns State Park.
This includes Route 90 between mile markers 294 and 301.
This includes the following streams and drainages... Apache Canyon, Cadillac Wash, Middle Canyon Wash, San Pedro River, Cienega Creek, Mescal Arroyo and Montosa Canyon.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 3:30 PM MST. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD WARNING is in effect for this area until 3:30 PM MST. This is a dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 3:30 PM MST. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 3:30 PM MST. Esta es una situacion peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
